definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: cause to tremble, tremble (in terror, or awe) (cf. Ar. 9aris.a quiver, flicker; Syr. 9ras. come upon suddenly or violently, PS s.v. passim; cf. Egypt. ‘u-ra-ḏ-au(t), they terrified (= [[ערחו]]) WMM:As. u. Eur. 76);—

cause to tremble (i.e. strike with awe) c. acc. [[הָאָרֶץ]] Is 2:19, Is 2:21 (subj. ´[[י]]; ins. prob. also v:Is 2:10); [[הֶעָלֶה נִדָּף]] ´[[תַּע]] Job 13:25 wilt thou strike with awe the driven leaf ? abs. cause trembling = inspire awe Is 47:12 (of Bab.), Ps 10:18.
intrans. tremble, feel dread (D), De 1:29, De 7:21, De 20:3, De 31:6, Jos 1:9; c. acc. Job 31:34 because I stood in awe of the great multitude.

definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: Pt. [[אֵל נַעֲרָץ]] Ps 89:8 El, terrible in the company of the holy ones (‖[[נוֹרָא]]).

definitions.title: Hiph. 1.
definitions.body: regard, or treat, with awe, as awful: 2 mpl. [[וְלאׁ תַעֲרִָיחוּ]] Is 8:12 (acc. [[מוֹרָאוֹ]]); 3 mpl. [[יַעֲרִָיחוּ]] Is 29:23 acc. ´[[אֶת־אֱלֽהֵי יִשׂ]].

definitions.title: Qal 2
definitions.body: );—Pt. sf. [[הוּא מַעֲרִֽחְכֶם]] Is 8:13 he shall be your awe-inspirer.
